Help.#cdata:
Syntax: %CMPRES (text | text expression)

Compresses multiple blanks and removes leading and trailing blanks.

Syntax: %QCMPRES (text | text expression)

Compresses multiple blanks and removes leading and trailing blanks.

%QCMPRES masks the result so special characters and mnemonic operators are treated 
as text instead of being interpreted by the macro facility.

Syntax: %COMPSTOR (PATHNAME=SAS-data-library)

Compiles macros and stores them in a catalog in a permanent SAS library.

Syntax:%DATATYP (text | text expression)

Returns the data type (numeric or char) of a value.

Syntax: %LEFT(text | text expression)
    
Left-aligns an argument by removing leading blanks.

Syntax: %QLEFT(text | text expression)

Left-aligns an argument by removing leading blanks.

QLEFT masks the result so special characters and mnemonic operators are treated as 
text instead of being interpreted by the macro facility.

Syntax: %QLOWCASE(text | text expression)

Changes uppercase characters to lowercase and returns a result that masks special 
characters and mnemonic operators.

[Syntax: %SYSRC(character-string)]

Returns a value corresponding to an error condition.

Syntax: %TRIM(text | text expression)

Trim trailing blanks.

Syntax: %QTRIM(text | text expression)
    
Trim trailing blanks. Masks special characters and mnemonic operators.

Syntax: %VERIFY(source, excerpt)
    
Returns the position of the first character unique to an expression.

Syntax: %DQLOAD(DQLOCALE=(locale1 ...localeN), DQSETUPLOC=`file-specification', <DQINFO=0 | 1>)
    
Sets system option values and loads locales into memory.

Syntax: %DQPUTLOC(locale, <SHORT=0 | 1>, <PARSEDEFN=0 | 1)>
    
Displays current information on a specified locale in the SAS log.

Syntax: %DQUNLOAD 
    
Unloads all locales to increase the amount of free memory.

Syntax: %KLOWCASE (text | text expression) 

Changes uppercase alphabetic characters to their lowercase equivalents. If the argument 
might contain a special character or mnemonic operator, listed below, use %QKLOWCAS. 

%KLOWCASE returns a result without quotation marks, even if the argument has quotation marks. 
%QKLOWCAS produces a result with the following special characters and mnemonic operators masked 
so the macro processor interprets them as text instead of as elements of the macro language: 

  & % ' " ( ) + - * / < > = ¬ ^ ~ ; , blank AND OR NOT EQ NE LE LT GE GT IN 

Autocall macros are included in a SAS library. This library might not be installed at your site 
or might be a site-specific version. If you cannot access this macro or if you want to find out 
if the library is a site-specific version, see your on-site SAS support personnel.

Syntax: %QKLOWCAS (text | text expression) 

Changes uppercase alphabetic characters to their lowercase equivalents. If the argument 
might contain a special character or mnemonic operator, listed below, use %QKLOWCAS. 

%KLOWCASE returns a result without quotation marks, even if the argument has quotation marks. 
%QKLOWCAS produces a result with the following special characters and mnemonic operators masked 
so the macro processor interprets them as text instead of as elements of the macro language: 

  & % ' " ( ) + - * / < > = ¬ ^ ~ ; , blank AND OR NOT EQ NE LE LT GE GT IN 

Autocall macros are included in a SAS library. This library might not be installed at your site 
or might be a site-specific version. If you cannot access this macro or if you want to find out 
if the library is a site-specific version, see your on-site SAS support personnel.

Syntax: %KTRIM (text | text expression) 
    
Trims trailing blanks. If the argument contains a special character or mnemonic operator, 
listed below, use %QKTRIM. 

QKTRIM produces a result with the following special characters and mnemonic operators masked 
so the macro processor interprets them as text instead of as elements of the macro language: 

  & % ' " ( ) + - * / < > = ¬ ? ~ ; , # blank AND OR NOT EQ NE LE LT GE GT IN 
  
Autocall macros are included in a SAS library. This library might not be installed at your 
site or might be a site-specific version. If you cannot access this macro or if you want to 
find out if the library is a site-specific version, see your on-site SAS support personnel.

Syntax: %QKTRIM (text | text expression) 
 
    
Trims trailing blanks. If the argument contains a special character or mnemonic operator, 
listed below, use %QKTRIM. 

QKTRIM produces a result with the following special characters and mnemonic operators masked 
so the macro processor interprets them as text instead of as elements of the macro language: 

  & % ' " ( ) + - * / < > = ¬ ? ~ ; , # blank AND OR NOT EQ NE LE LT GE GT IN 
  
Autocall macros are included in a SAS library. This library might not be installed at your 
site or might be a site-specific version. If you cannot access this macro or if you want to 
find out if the library is a site-specific version, see your on-site SAS support personnel.

Syntax: %KVERIFY (source, excerpt) 

Returns the position of the first character unique to an expression. 

Arguments:
source 
  is text or a text expression that you want to examine for characters that do not exist in excerpt. 
excerpt 
  is text or a text expression that defines the set of characters that %KVERIFY uses to examine source.
